alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Brevard County; Orange; Seminole; Southern Brevard County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 10:55AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Seminole, northwestern Brevard, southeastern Orange, southeastern Volusia and Osceola Counties through 1145 AM EST... At 1055 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Klondike Beach to West Lake Toho and into Polk County. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Titusville, Saint Cloud and Rockledge. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EST for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Brevard County; Orange; Seminole; Southern Brevard County
